snippet: Is tax law being widely flouted by political groups determined to avoid disclosure of their donors?
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column explores byzantine tax laws that inform the Internal Revenue Service's decision to scrutinize Tea Party organizations that had claimed tax-exempt status; argues that political scandal will likely decrease incentive for IRS to pursue political groups that are flouting law to avoid disclosure of their donors.
lead_paragraph: Is tax law being widely flouted by political groups determined to avoid disclosure of their donors?

headline.print_headline: A Fine Line Between Social And Political
headline.seo: A Fine Line Between Social Welfare and Politics
headline.main: A Fine Line Between Social and Political
